title: How to Boot a PC or Mac from a CD or DVD

steps.title: Insert the CD or DVD into your computer.
steps.content: Insert the CD or DVD into your computer. To do so, place the disc logo side-up in your computer's CD or DVD-ROM tray.

steps.title: Boot your computer into the BIOS or UEFI.
steps.content: Boot your computer into the BIOS or UEFI. Before you can boot from a CD or DVD, make sure the computer's boot sequence is set to boot from a removable disc before the hard drive. To get started, you'll have to boot into your PC's BIOS . There are two ways to do this: The first option is to reboot your computer and immediately press the setup key repeatedly until you've reached the BIOS. This key is usually F2 , Del , F10 , or F1 . If you're not sure, Google your PC model and "BIOS setup key." Windows 10: Press Windows key + i , go to Update & Security > Recovery , and click Restart Now under "Advanced Startup." Windows 11: Press Windows key + i , go to System > Recovery , and click Restart Now under "Advanced Startup. Once you're at the blue Advanced Options screen, click UEFI Firmware Settings and then click Restart .

steps.title: Navigate to the Boot tab.
steps.content: Navigate to the Boot tab. You'll use the arrow keys to select it. The Boot tab may instead say Boot Options , depending on your computer's manufacturer.

steps.title: Select the CD-ROM Drive option.
steps.content: Select the CD-ROM Drive option. To do so, press the ↓ arrow until this option has a box around it. This may be called DVD-ROM or Optical Drive.

steps.title: Press the + key until CD-ROM Drive is first.
steps.content: Press the + key until CD-ROM Drive is first. This will place it at the top of the boot options list. You may have to press a different key as indicated by the key legend on the far-right side of the BIOS screen.

steps.title: Save your settings.
steps.content: Save your settings. You should see a key prompt (e.g., F10 ) at the bottom of the screen that correlates to "Save and Exit"; pressing it will restart your computer, using the CD drive as a reboot point. You may have to press ↵ Enter to confirm the changes.

steps.title: Insert the CD or DVD into your computer.
steps.content: Insert the CD or DVD into your computer. To do so, slide the disc logo side-up into the CD-ROM or DVD-ROM slot on your Mac. The CD must have a version of Mac OS on it to qualify as a boot option. Some Macs don't have CD slots. If your Mac doesn't have a CD slot, you'll need to purchase an external CD drive.

steps.title: Click .
steps.content: Click . It's in the upper-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Click Restart.
steps.content: Click Restart . This option is at the bottom of the Apple menu.

steps.title: Click Restart when prompted.
steps.content: Click Restart when prompted. Doing so will cause your Mac to begin restarting.

steps.title: Hold down the ⌘ Command key.
steps.content: Hold down the ⌘ Command key. You'll need to hold down ⌘ Command as soon as your Mac begins restarting, and keep holding it until the Startup Manager window appears.

steps.title: Click the CD icon.
steps.content: Click the CD icon. It will typically say something like "Mac OS X Install DVD" below it. Clicking this icon selects it.

steps.title: Press ⏎ Return.
steps.content: Press ⏎ Return . Doing so will prompt your Mac to boot from the CD drive.
